intro: Isoplesion, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its lack of leaves, relying instead on its roots for photosynthesis. The plant produces striking white or pale green flowers that bloom in late summer. Isoplesion thrives in wet, peat-rich environments and is often found in swamps or along the edges of ponds. Due to its habitat specificity and declining population, it is considered endangered and is protected in many areas.
